content.title: Iliac Artery Endofibrosis
content.description: Non-atherosclerotic stenosis of external iliac artery in endurance athletes

key_concepts.details: Competitive cyclists, triathletes, other endurance athletes; typically 30-50 years
Subintimal fibrosis causing stenosis; not atherosclerosis
Leg weakness/pain at high-intensity exercise; normal resting ABI
Surgical endarterectomy or release of vascular constraint; endovascular generally avoided

content.clinical_significance: High-level athletes with exercise-limiting leg symptoms need specific evaluation
content.statement: Iliac Artery Endofibrosis is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Iliac Artery Endofibrosis helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Iliac Artery Endofibrosis include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Iliac Artery Endofibrosis.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Iliac Artery Endofibrosis. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
